channel.title: An rsps repository
channel.description: I remember this feature on an old rsps forum and I think Moparscape would make use of this - an RSPS source repository. It will be an entire new page (like a toplist) organized into all of the different revisions - 317, 474, 508, etc. And in each section is a list of rsps sources of that given revision. Maybe even a voting system to differ between the quality and (lack for a better word) shitty sources. This feature will make finding a quality source fast; and not surrounded/buried by other sources that are inferior and of less-quality. Instead of just posting your freshly-finished source you worked hard on into the rsps downloads board, submit it into the official moparscape repository for potential users to easily find, use, and rate your source.

maybe it would be better to make it peer to peer then?

item.title: An rsps repository
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The files can’t be stored on Moparisthebest’s server because doing so is direct contravention of laws surrounding intellectual property (the ones that are crystal clear, as opposed to legal grey areas like linking to intellectual property as opposed to actually hosting it).

Of course, if someone were to accumulate a collection and host them somewhere reliable then perhaps they could place a link in their signature and people would catch on.

Read full topic

It’s different cause we aren’t directly hosting the links, others post the links.

That makes no difference, all posts on this forum belong to mitb as soon as they’re posted.
[/quote]I forget the link at the moment but the one about the law stuff? It says in there doesn’t it that the reason why they didn’t get shut down was cause the links were not his. I do understand what you are saying though.[/quote]

Mitb does directly host the links - he just doesn’t host the things that they link to.

Read full topic

item.title: An rsps repository
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Guys, get your shit together:

[quote=“mitb”]Hello from moparisthebest.com,

I am the owner and operator of moparisthebest.com, as such I do not allow any copyrighted or illegal items on my server, and I work hard to keep it that way.

If you would be so kind to point me to any items that are illegal or copyrighted on my server, I would be more than happy to immediately remove them.

Please reply with this information in at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely

moparisthebest[/quote]
Again: http://www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff

Edit, Also:

mitb:

The internet is made of links, if it were not for links, I would have never found runescape.com to play your game, if it were not for links, you would have never found moparisthebest.com, links are not and cannot be illegal.

Read full topic

item.title: An rsps repository
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:528208”][quote author=asyo4 link=topic=646959.msg4350675#msg4350675 date=1376595999]
I remember this feature on an old rsps forum and I think Moparscape would make use of this - an RSPS source repository. It will be an entire new page (like a toplist) organized into all of the different revisions - 317, 474, 508, etc. And in each section is a list of rsps sources of that given revision. Maybe even a voting system to differ between the quality and (lack for a better word) shitty sources. This feature will make finding a quality source fast; and not surrounded/buried by other sources that are inferior and of less-quality. Instead of just posting your freshly-finished source you worked hard on into the rsps downloads board, submit it into the official moparscape repository for potential users to easily find, use, and rate your source.

[/quote]
We’d be shut down in a month or less.
A lot done with RSPS is illegal, the only reason mopar hasn’t got in trouble with it is because of: http://www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff[/quote]

How? My suggestion is no different from the “Server downloads” board. Maybe im missing something =/

Read full topic
